div.div: Messes up mapping runs most of the time. Pace can be wildly off.

Loved this app. Now it doesn't work at all. It has no clue where I am, telling me I run a mile in 3 minutes and then a couple seconds later telling me I completed another mile in 30 seconds. Although I wish this was true as I would be the fastest person on earth, the app is simply broken. I tried turning off my phone. Still broken. This has happened on multiple, multiple occasions. Time to try something new...
I was enjoying the end of my run, listening to my tunes when AN AUDIO AD THIS LOUD STARTED BLASTING IN MY EARS. And I couldn't stop it. Confusing, annoying, pointless.

div.strong: Ugh 1 more failure and I'm deleting the app.

div.div: Really stinks when I'm ready to go out the door and it won't let me sign in. Or today I came home and it had signed out while I was going. Tracked while I was running but as soon as I finished, it had logged me out. Really aggravating.

I used to use this app everyday for our daily neighborhood walks with the dog and kid. I'm not training for Iron Man over here, I just want a light, easy GPS app to track our mileage. This WAS perfect for that.
Opened it today to find a MANDATORY update to this garbage UnderArmor version. Now it's useless. Corporate sponsor, required sign-in, subscription fees, ads... They ruined it for me. Deleted.
You cannot create a run manually on the app, you have to go to the website.

I purchased the 1 year subscription for the MVP. It will work after purchase but the next time I log on my membership is gone and I have to resubscribe. It doesn't show on MMR's website either. Very disappointed in the functionality. If you want it just to track your distance it's great. If you want to use this app to actually train for pace and intervals it's got some glitches.

div.strong: Worst running app for Apple Watch

div.div: Compared to the other running apps I have (Strava & RunKeeper), MapMyRun is the worst one when using it with the Apple Watch because it does’t have all of your info on one screen. They have all the info on separate screens: distance, time, calories and pause/stop. Why in the world wouldn’t they put all of that info on one screen?!! They don’t even tell you your pace. The ONLY reason I keep using it is because I get points with Sports Authority. But, honestly, I still mostly use RunKeeper and then export/import into my MayMyRun account.

div.strong: The challenges are a terrible idea

div.div:
This app does its basic function fine I suppose but the fact that it is subscription based pricing means I'll never hand over a single cent. If I could buy the MVP version for a 1 time fee, I may consider it.
The app is sorts clumsy. The UI could be much easier to access while doing activities like running. Things like bigger buttons, and a more streamlined and organized interface would go a long way.
The worst part about this app is probably the intrusive "challenges" feature the designers are BEGGING you to look at. So much so to the point where after starting a workout, you immediately get notifications for these new work out challenges. In order to clear these challenges you must open the menu and go into the screen to view them. This entire feature is pointless and time consuming. Very few things irritate me as much as apps that force you to acknowledge notifications in order to remove the icon.
My Phy Ed teacher makes me use this

I've had this app since it was out. MVP and it was great. NOW it's HORRIBLE. GPS doesn't work, activity feed craps out. It's a mess. I've provided feedback, no response. I've updated to latest versions (mistake) and deleted and reloaded the app to try and fix it. I will have to find another app as I can't train on trails without GPS. It's a waste to not track my progress in training. So disappointing.

So far im not impressed, all i wanted to do was track the run i just did, apparently this is exceptionally difficult, i cant seem to just create a route using the map, i can only seem to choose preprogrammed routes unless i ise the website which seems totally impossible on my phone, maybe 5000 hours on youtube will help me figure it out, i was hoping for something easier to use :(
I used to have great results with this app but now it doesn't GPS properly. I've tried it in NYC and in South Florida. GPS doesn't work well on this app.
Who are these strangers showing up on my activity feed. How can I delete them? I am about ready to delete this app😡
Used to love this app but now it's terrible. It has me running over rivers and running 5 minute miles. Please fix.

Mapmyrun asks for your feedback about the run after each run. If you respond 'yes' you are happy thy direct you to rate their app. If you answer 'no' they don't direct you to rate their up but ask for your feedback. This is clearly dishonest. If you go ahead and type your feedback under 'no' I'm not happy scenario, they respond with a generic email directing you to q&a links etc. this is by far one of the worst customer service I have ever seen Also, customer service has been tap-dancing around without giving me a straight answer on the fact that the app forces your information on the Web if you choose to post your runs on Facebook. So here is the problem. If you have set your privacy so you can share your runs with friends in Facebook, your runs will automatically be posted on the web. For me, this is a major breach of privacy. After numerous unfruitful exchanges with customer service, I'm led to believe that this is not a mere technical glitch but more so an intentional loop so that mapmyrun gets higher web hits. It's just frustrating that apps can get away with such flagrant breach of privacy.

I was so excited when I got this app. The ability to map, time and save my workouts was amazing. Until I discovered that the GPS is an entire quarter of a mile off!! I am highly disappointed. For someone looking to time their miles appropriately, I would not recommend this app.
Terrible user experience. Cannot add routes when logging or see routes in more detail. Why even download?

div.strong: Terrible at tracking miles and calories

div.div: I use this in conjunction with the Nike running app just so I can get the coupons from completing challenges. App says I'm running a 2 min mile...um no.

You can't create new routes in the app for some reason, ok, fine, brought up the website on my PC. Try to create a route, get an error message. Followed all the suggestions (clear cache, delete cookies, disable extensions, etc. etc.) but still get the same error.
After telling support this and them telling me to try what I'd already tried, their solution? Don't use Firefox.
I assume not everyone using FF has this problem, but I'll definitely be using RunKeeper instead.
Didn't work at all on I phone 6 plus. Time was way off ran thirty min. App said 5. Also showed 0 miles. I give it 0 stars. But it won't go that low.
Thought it worked well at first but now it is not keeping up with my running! It won't track all my run! 😡 do not get this app.

div.strong: Don't upgrade from the free version!!!!!!!

div.div: Just upgraded from the free version! It's misleading and forces the app user to pay for the free features had..very deceiving!!!
Started out working fine, but now, 9 times out of 10 it crashes on me if I try to do anything else with my phone while this app is running.

So here is the deal, I love this app, use it almost everyday. Problem comes with each new release it prompts me to review it. Well I've already rated it 5 stars so I can't review it again yet each time I use it it prompts me for a review until I write another one. Driving me nuts to the point I'm going to start looking at other apps.
I enjoyed using this app in the past, but when I used it recently, it required a login to use. No thanks

I use the Nike app to track my runs so I only use this to find nearby runs when I need to increase my distance or I'm in another city and don't know where to run. so it's pretty useless that there's only one run near me that comes up no matter what distance I put in between 3-8 miles. I guess it's only showing what people have recorded and those people are fine to just run endless loops around the reservoir near me. you have to pay to upgrade to get a run other than the crap people post. I guess it's a flaw of the users more than the app but it's a definite limitation making the app ultimately useless to me.

The app is great, 5 stars easily. However, with one of the most recent versions, a calibration circle screen comes up right as I'm trying to end of my run preventing me from ending it. This has happened my last 5 or so runs. Makes me want to punch a baby. Don't do that to babies. Take the calibration screen off. It's calibrated enough already. Will return to 5 stars when this is removed.

I've been using the app for several years and I think it's time I just delete it. It crashes maybe 1 of every 5 runs. It ruins how I track my training programs every time it does this because I lose my data.
I ran with it today and it didn't crash, it just fudged my data. It told me I was running a 4:30 split on miles 6-9, which is waaay off. I wish I could run that fast. It logged more miles and a faster pace than what I did. If it cannot track well every time, it's absolutely useless to me. I need an app I can rely on and I'm afraid this one is not it. I'm way over this app and finally washing my hands of it.
Don't download unless you want a lot of heartache.

I liked this app at first. In fact, I liked it so much that I paid for a yearly subscription. Now only two months in...I can not access my MVP benefits, and changes have been made to my account suddenly. I have requested help for the past two weeks and have only gotten form letter responses with directions telling me to log on and off...well I did and I still can't access the membership I paid for. I am very frustrated...and don't recommend for anyone to pay the extra $ for the MVP membership.
Stop forcing either a review or critique after every run. It's annoying.

div.strong: Won't be using this app anymore

div.div: I just did a 2.4 mile run. The app recorded it as .48 miles. I just took my car out on the route to see exactly how far it was. I'll be using a different app from now on.

div.strong: I found this to be useless

div.div: I wanted this app for 1 thing, to draw a line on a map and have it tell me the distance I just ran. Apparently the app does not do this, despite it being the freaking name of the app. If I wanted to track calories and log workouts, I'd just use the FitBit app. PLEASE DO THE ONE THING I USED THIS FOR IN THE PAST. Horrible.

Worked once out of 3 attempts. Run 1 worked fine. Run 2 the app crashed and didn't track anything. Run 3 I tapped the 'start my run' button, started running, and at the end realized it decided to advertise upgrades to buy instead of tracking my run.... Which ostensibly the app is intended to do. Find a different one, this is worthless.

div.strong: App shuts off all the time!

div.div: On half of my runs, the app closes and stops tracking data. This leaves me in the middle of my runs waiting for my pace and time. Then when I finish my run, I open the app and it says that I had twenty second mile paces.
This app has recently become inaccurate for distance/speed for some of my common routes. Disappointed training!
This app is a shell of what it used to be. I want to map out a run and it can't do that. It's an activity tracker owned by UnderArmor and design to sell you products. Avoid it like the plague.

Pauses in the middle of works outs without even touching the screen, I used it only twice then deleted it. I figure it works like crap by design so you'll pay for the upgraded app! Zero stars total garbage

Loved this app before. They just updated it and now its junk. Crashed 5 min into a run. Started it again. On the next try it added two random segments to my run, adding a fictitious mile! Im tired of apps being updated with terrible QA and being ruined. Guess I will add this one to the ever growing deleted list.
Not planning to use until watch app stops freezing...nothing more frustrating than being 0.5 miles into a run to find the app is frozen...
I ran the inside lane around a few different high school tracks. Every time it says I'm at mile when I've only went about 3.5 laps...tested it multiple times.

I have deleted this app do too I had to sign in and give all my information to this app. Not going to do it. You can do the same thing on Runkeeper and you don't have to give any information just click and go for a walk run jog climb it will record it for you

div.strong: cannot figure out how to actually create a route

div.div: really annoying. wasted 20 minutes

div.strong: Use to be good now worthless

div.div: I've used this app for several years with no issues. Now it's bad to worse. 1. Shuts down my blue tooth connection to my head phones. 2. If I'm on the treadmill it can't even keep track of the amount of time I ran. I have to manually type in time and distance now. Worthless. I'm so done with this junk app

div.strong: Great idea, but app always fails

div.div: I love the idea of the app. I use it now on every run, but problems with the app always mess up my pace, distance, and overall running time. The app often closes whenever I try to end my run and it takes a whole for it to start up again so that I can pause and save my workout. When I'm training down to the second on pace times, it's frustrating to have inaccurate final saved times. If this were fixed, I would give the app 4 maybe 5 stars.

EVERY time I attempt using this app, it either force closes, takes forever to startup so I force close and retry, or makes my phone inoperable to the point where I have to restart it. I cannot text while using it. The screen becomes unresponsive and I have to restart my phone. I can't switch between apps, or I have to restart my phone. Are you noticing the pattern that I am? Because it's rather frustrating.

I'm very disappointed with this app. When I open the App it takes around 5 minutes to begin working. It constantly freezes, and when it freezes, it freezes my entire phone not allowing me to do anything else. I used this app a few years ago and it worked well. I had great hopes that the bugs would be fixed, however they are not.

I updated on 7/4/15 and now the app no longer tracks elevation, it also is not as good with pairing with my under armor HR monitor. Was a great app until this most recent version. Completely and utterly frustrating

This app is gimmicky and always crashing. The features mostly ask you to subscribe to a monthly fee, and the app crashes roughly once every five runs. I can't deal with this app any more. If you consider yourself a real runner in any capacity, do yourself a favor and avoid this app.
This app keeps freezing my iPhone 5s I can't do anything while the app is running. Please fix this
